abstract: Dow Jones & Company said Thursday that Kraft Foods would replace the American International Group in the Dow Jones Industrial Average when trading begins Monday.
lead_paragraph: Dow Jones & Company said Thursday that Kraft Foods would replace the American International Group in the Dow Jones Industrial Average when trading begins Monday.

headline.main: Kraft to Replace A.I.G. in Dow Average

abstract: A seesaw day on Wall Street ended with a rush of euphoria Thursday as investors raced back into beaten-down banking shares, heartened by signs that the government is taking more drastic steps to tamp down problems plaguing the financial markets.
lead_paragraph: A seesaw day on Wall Street ended with a rush of euphoria Thursday as investors raced back into beaten-down banking shares, heartened by signs that the government is taking more drastic steps to tamp down problems plaguing the financial markets.

headline.main: Investors, Hungry for Hope, Send Dow Up 410

abstract: Realizing that its actions so far have been insufficient, the government is starting to put in place a sweeping plan to restore confidence in the financial markets.
snippet: Realizing that its actions so far have been insufficient, the government is starting to put in place a sweeping plan to restore confidence in the financial markets.
lead_paragraph: The Bush administration began discussions with Congress on Friday to hammer out an extraordinary plan to rescue banks and financial institutions by having the government buy up a big share of the nation’s vast mortgage market.

headline.main: Dow Rises 370 Points as U.S. Plans Financial Rescue Package
headline.print_headline: Stocks Surge as U.S. Moves to Stabilize Markets

byline.original: By Edmund L. Andrews and Graham Bowley
